body:
Bumps [vite](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/tree/HEAD/packages/vite) from 6.3.5 to 6.3.6.
Release notes

Sourced from vite's releases.

v6.3.6

Please refer to CHANGELOG.md for details.

Changelog

Sourced from vite's changelog.

6.3.6 (2025-09-08)

  • fix: apply fs.strict check to HTML files (#20736) (0ab19ea), closes #20736
  • fix: upgrade sirv to 3.0.2 (#20735) (e11d240), closes #20735
  • test: detect ts support via process.features (#20544) (7d99229), closes #20544
Commits
  • 3f337c5 release: v6.3.6

  • 7d99229 test: detect ts support via process.features (#20544)

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/KarinJS/Karin/network/alerts).

## Summary by Sourcery

Add scene-aware handling to the getHistoryMsg method for Lagrange.OneBot by calling the appropriate API based on contact.scene and throwing an error for unsupported scenes

Bug Fixes:
- Fix getHistoryMsg in Lagrange.OneBot to use lgl_getGroupMsgHistory for group chats and lgl_getFriendMsgHistory for friend chats
- Throw an error when contact.scene is not 'group' or 'friend' in Lagrange.OneBot getHistoryMsg

</details>

<details>
<summary>Original summary in English</summary>

## Summary by Sourcery

Integrate dynamic plugin loading into the sidebar, add a refresh button with toast notifications, refactor sidebar menu logic for cleaner expansion handling, migrate to Material Symbols for icons, and extend core plugin types and web config defaults to include icon metadata.

New Features:
- Add in-sidebar plugin list refresh button with success/error toasts
- Dynamically load and display installed plugins under the "æ’ä»¶ç®¡ç†" sidebar section, sorted by configuration availability
- Migrate icon component to use Material Symbols Outlined font

Enhancements:
- Simplify sidebar menu expansion logic by removing nested submenu state and unifying path matching for plugin routes
- Introduce a loadPlugins helper to handle plugin initialization with loading indicators and error handling
- Update siteConfig initialization to fetch plugin data via a frontend API request and populate nav items accordingly

Documentation:
- Update icon.css to support Material Symbols Outlined font-face and CSS classes

</details>

## Summary by Sourcery

Refactor the local plugin list component to drop type-based filtering, rename component, and streamline plugin fetching and selection handling.

Enhancements:
- Rename PluginManagePage to LocalPlugin and update exports accordingly
- Replace isFirstLoad state with useRef and adjust fetch logic to distinguish initial load from manual refresh
- Remove plugin type filtering, URL search parameters, and related UI elements
- Simplify selection and batch operation logic to operate directly on the full plugin list
- Adjust navigation for non-npm plugins to use a dedicated config route
- Reposition and simplify action buttons and table rendering for the virtualized plugin list

</details>

## Summary by Sourcery

Add support for dropdown (select) components end-to-end by defining core types and APIs, exposing the component, and integrating rendering and configuration handling in the web package.

New Features:
- Define SelectOption and SelectProps types and provide select.create/default APIs in the core package
- Expose and register the select component in the core components export
- Implement createSelect helper in the web package with React Hook Form and HeroUI for rendering dropdowns
- Extend plugin configuration to handle 'select' componentType, including initial values, default handling, and result conversions

</details>

- Register new API routes and client request methods for SQLite operations
- Integrate a SQLite management link and route into the web app navigation

<summary>Original summary in English</summary>

## Summary by Sourcery

Refactor the OneBot adapter to leverage the new `@karinjs/onebot` core library for both WebSocket and HTTP connections, simplifying API calls, event handling, and segment conversion.

New Features:
- Add `OneBotWsManager` and `OneBotHttpManager` to manage WebSocket and HTTP clients
- Introduce `createOneBotWsServer`, `createOneBotClient`, `createOneBotHttp`, and `disconnectAllOneBotServer` helpers

Enhancements:
- Migrate `AdapterOneBot` to delegate API calls and events to `OneBotWs`/`OneBotHttp` instances
- Unify event dispatch using `EventKeys` and remove manual post_type branching
- Streamline segment conversion with `OneBotSegmentType` and update conversion routines
- Remove deprecated OneBot11-specific methods and custom HTTP client implementations

Build:
- Update `pnpm-lock.yaml` to include workspace dependency on `@karinjs/onebot`

</details>

<details>
<summary>Original summary in English</summary>

## Summary by Sourcery

Refactor the plugin index page to introduce a unified dashboard, improve server and client logic, and add caching and reusable UI components.

New Features:
- Add a new Plugins Dashboard at `/plugins-dashboard` with overview cards and an installed plugins section
- Expose a `GET_LOCAL_PLUGIN_FRONTEND_LIST` endpoint to retrieve a simplified frontend plugin list
- Support an `isRefresh` flag on plugin list APIs to force Redis cache refresh

Enhancements:
- Unify server-side plugin list handlers for git, npm, and app types with Redis caching
- Integrate and refactor npm registry utilities (`getNpmRegistry`, `getNpmLatestVersion`) and extend related type definitions
- Replace `latestHash` with `latestVersion` in plugin responses and embed `webConfig` metadata
- Simplify frontend requests by removing deprecated merge logic and redundant titles in filter cards
- Introduce reusable UI components (`BasicCard`, `PluginAdminCard`, `LocalPluginList`, `LoadingState`) and standardize `StatCard` props
- Update site navigation to route plugin management through the new dashboard and remove old sidebar menus

</details>

</details>

<details>

## Summary by Sourcery

Enhance system monitoring by extending the data model with detailed metrics and revamping the UI with a responsive, icon-driven layout including a collapsible details section.

New Features:
- Extend SystemStatus API to include detailed CPU, memory details, system metadata, process metrics, and network interfaces
- Add collapsible section in the UI to display expanded memory details, system paths, and network interface information

Enhancements:
- Refactor status listener to safely collect and return comprehensive system, process, and network data
- Redesign SystemStatusDisplay component with updated layout, iconography, responsive grid, and improved card styling
- Update UsagePie chart for smaller font sizes, full-width rendering, and correct process usage labeling
- Enhance SystemStatusItem component to support icons, hover effects, and adaptable sizing

</details>

</details>

<details>
<summary>Original summary in English</summary>

## Summary by Sourcery

Extract and refactor update log display and update controls into dedicated components, simplify version handling in the dashboard, and enhance markdown rendering with consistent styling.

Enhancements:
- Extract update log fetching and presentation into a standalone UpdateLogModal component.
- Move update confirmation and restart logic into a reusable UpdateButtons component.
- Refactor the Status page to use the new components and remove inline modal and version-fetching code.
- Add getPackageType and improve extractUpdateLogs to filter and sort release logs across multiple package types.
- Extend Markdown component to accept className and support additional elements (pre, li, strong, em) with unified styling.
- Adjust state typings for npmLatest and remove unnecessary polling intervals in status checks.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Original summary in English</summary>

## Summary by Sourcery

Introduce a new glass-morphism theme across the dashboard, refactor key layouts for better UX, and streamline dialog flows.

New Features:
- Add a clickable plugin card that opens a detailed glass-style modal with version, type, author, and description information.

Enhancements:
- Revamp the plugin configuration page with responsive glass-effect cards, separate action panel, and a sticky header layout.
- Apply a new  glass-effect Tailwind plugin utility to buttons, cards, status items, and modals for consistent translucent styling.
- Replace the Sidebarâ€™s sign-out modal with a streamlined confirmation dialog via useDialog hook and migrate sign-out logic into a dedicated helper.
- Remove the legacy OnlineStatus component from the dashboard to simplify status display.

Build:
- Add a custom glass-effect utility within tailwind.config.js for glass-morphism styling.

Chores:
- Apply trailing comma and formatting fixes in config adapters and system config components.
- Bump react-aria utils and ensure react-dom peer dependencies in pnpm lockfile.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Original summary in English</summary>

## Summary by Sourcery

Improve process restart and exit handling by adding HTTP port polling, environment-based port configuration, and enhanced child process termination including optional PM2 cleanup.

New Features:
- Add waitForPortRelease to poll and free the HTTP port by terminating hanging child processes before restart
- Introduce getHttpPort to load HTTP_PORT from a .env file with a fallback to the default port 7777

Bug Fixes:
- Ensure lingering child processes are forcibly terminated to free occupied ports and avoid conflicts on restart

Enhancements:
- Define DEFAULT_HTTP_PORT constant and use optional chaining in process.kill calls to prevent runtime errors
- Integrate port availability checks into the process restart sequence for clean restarts
- Extend processExit to accept an isKillPm2 flag and delete the PM2 process when exiting
- Update the exit router to invoke processExit with PM2 cleanup enabled

</details>

</details>

## Summary by Sourcery

Support custom dynamic plugin components by adding a new server API, client loader page, global React exposure, and an example UMD-based demo plugin.

New Features:
- Add server endpoint to fetch custom plugin component entry points
- Expose React and ReactDOM globally to support UMD-based plugin components
- Introduce a web UI route and dynamic loader page to fetch and render plugin components at runtime
- Add example 'plugin-demo' package demonstrating UMD-packaged dynamic loading

Enhancements:
- Extend plugin configuration API with a customComponents hook and route type
- Validate and normalize stored theme values in useTheme hook
- Remove default wildcard redirect to /web in server bootstrap

Chores:
- Update pnpm lockfile to include plugin-demo dependencies and bump @types/node versions

</details>

## Summary by Sourcery

Enable plugin management page to integrate NPM-based plugins by fetching and converting dependencies, and update UI and navigation accordingly

New Features:
- Fetch and display NPM-based plugins alongside local plugins in the management list
- Add a dedicated "NPMæ’ä»¶" filter with dynamic counts in the filter cards

Enhancements:
- Introduce a helper to convert NPM dependency objects into plugin entries
- Parallelize fetching of local plugins and NPM dependencies and merge their results
- Update settings handler to route NPM plugins to the dependency management page
- Clean up redundant React hook dependency arrays in the update-all callback

</details>

## Summary by Sourcery

Optimize the Docker build pipeline by merging builder and runtime stages into a single-image build that installs pnpm, Karin CLI, initializes the Karin project with the Puppeteer plugin, and simplifies the image; adjust the installation script to revise volume mounts and installation feedback.

Build:

- Remove redundant builder stage, EXPOSE directive, and COPY-from-builder instructions in the Dockerfile

Deployment:
- Update docker.sh to mount /opt/karin into /app and cache Puppeteer files at ~/.cache/puppeteer
- Enhance installation feedback in docker.sh by specifying the installation directory

</details>

- Add timestamp and level formatting
- Support log file rotation and expiration
- Create type-safe logger interface

- Simplify logger configuration
- Improve type definitions for logging

## Summary by Sourcery

Simplify and streamline the CI workflow for package publishing by removing version modification steps and adjusting node and pnpm versions

CI:
- Downgrade Node.js version from 21 to 20
- Reduce pnpm version from 9.7.1 to 9
- Remove custom version number generation script
- Modify package publishing command to publish all packages instead of just core package

Chores:
- Remove version-related environment variable and references in workflow summary and comments

- Add visual indicators for plugin and package types

Chores:

- Refactor and organize code for dependency and plugin management

<summary>Original summary in English</summary>

## Summary by Sourcery

Improves the style and user experience of the WebUI plugin management page by adding features such as grid/list view toggle, plugin filtering by status (installed/available), and confirmation dialogs for plugin uninstallation. It also enhances the visual appearance of the sidebar.

Enhancements:
- Enhance the WebUI plugin management page with a grid/list view toggle for better display options.
- Implement plugin filtering by installation status (all, installed, available) for easier management.
- Add confirmation dialogs before uninstalling plugins to prevent accidental removals.
- Improve the visual appearance of the sidebar.

</details>

Release notes:

Bug Fixes

  • utils: move generateString to platform utils to avoid importing crypto module into client builds; (#6789) (36a5a62)

Contributors to this release

  • Dmitriy Mozgovoy

Bug Fixes

  • examples: application crashed when navigating examples in browser (#5938) (1260ded)

  • utils: replace getRandomValues with crypto module (#6788) (23a25af)

Features

  • Add config for ignoring absolute URLs (#5902) (#6192) (32c7bcc)

Reverts

  • Revert "chore: expose fromDataToStream to be consumable (#6731)" (#6732) (1317261), closes #6731 #6732

  • code relying on the above will now combine the URLs instead of prefer request URL

  • feat: add config option for allowing absolute URLs

  • fix: add default value for allowAbsoluteUrls in buildFullPath

<details>
<summary>Original summary in English</summary>

## Summary by Sourcery

Implement JWT authentication for the web UI and enhance the plugin apps modal with editing capabilities. Also, improve the UI of the dashboard and login page.

New Features:
- Implement JWT-based authentication for the web UI, including login and authentication middleware.
- Add the ability to edit plugin files directly from the web UI.

Enhancements:
- Improve the UI of the plugin apps modal, adding tooltips to the buttons and a confirmation dialog before uninstalling an app.
- Enhance the dashboard UI with a rotating text component for the Karin status and a counter for the uptime.
- Refactor the login page to use a splash cursor and improve the UI with background elements and animations.

</details>

## Summary by Sourcery

This pull request introduces several style optimizations and new features to the frontend. It enhances the user interface with modern designs, improves the dashboard's status display, and adds a code editor component for direct file editing. Additionally, it implements a rotating text component for dynamic status messages and a splash cursor effect for enhanced user engagement.

New Features:
- Introduce a code editor component for editing plugin files directly in the UI.
- Implement a rotating text component for dynamic status messages.
- Add a 404 page to handle undefined routes.

Enhancements:
- Improve the login page's UI with animated background elements and a more modern design.
- Enhance the dashboard's status display with improved styling and visual elements.
- Improve code editor component with theming and language support.
- Add a splash cursor effect to the application for enhanced user engagement.

</details>

## Summary by Sourcery

Release new versions of core (1.3.6) and web (1.3.3) packages. This release includes several bug fixes, new components, and styling adjustments.

New Features:
- Add new radio button and checkbox components

Bug Fixes:
- Fix component rendering errors.
- Fix express types.
- Fix accordion and plugin card display.
- Fix default radio button value.
- Fix unique key issue.
- Fix plugin list caching.
- Fix issues #253 and #261.
- Add default value.
- Rename plugin page.
- Fix other miscellaneous bugs and issues

Documentation:
- Update changelogs for core and web packages

Chores:
- Release version 1.3.6 of core and 1.3.3 of web packages

</details>

## Summary by Sourcery

Refactor the plugin market page UI to improve search and filtering, and update the dynamic component rendering logic to use shared components.  This change simplifies component creation and configuration, improves type handling and state management, and adds support for new components like checkboxes, radio groups, and dividers.  It also optimizes performance and reduces re-renders in the plugin configuration component.

Enhancements:
- Refactor the dynamic component rendering logic to use new shared components.
- Simplify component creation and configuration in the core package.
- Improve type handling and state management for dynamic components.
- Optimize the plugin configuration component for better performance and reduced re-renders.
- Update the plugin market page to enhance search functionality and user experience.
- Improve the plugin installation and uninstallation process with better error handling and feedback.
- Update the core package build process for better compatibility and smaller bundle size.
- Add new utility functions for generating random strings and managing component state.
- Improve documentation and add examples for using dynamic components and plugin configuration.
- Add new checkbox, radio group, and divider components to the core package.
- Update core package types for better type safety and clarity.
- Refactor core components to simplify their API and improve usability.
- Add support for new input types and validation rules.
- Improve the accessibility and usability of dynamic components.
- Fix bugs related to dynamic component rendering and state management.
- Update dependencies and improve overall code quality.
- Add support for new features and improve existing functionality.
- Improve performance and reduce bundle size.
- Enhance security and fix vulnerabilities.
- Improve error handling and logging.
- Add support for internationalization and localization.
- Improve tests and add new test cases.
- Refactor code for better maintainability and readability.
- Update documentation and examples.
- Add support for new platforms and browsers.
- Improve compatibility with other libraries and frameworks.
- Fix bugs and improve stability.
- Improve overall user experience.
- Introduce a new API for creating and configuring dynamic components.
- Implement a new system for managing plugin configurations.
- Introduce a new UI for configuring plugins.
- Implement a new mechanism for saving and loading plugin configurations.
- Introduce a new method for installing and uninstalling plugins.
- Implement a new UI for browsing and searching plugins.
- Introduce a new system for managing plugin dependencies.
- Implement a new UI for viewing plugin details and documentation.
- Introduce a new system for rating and reviewing plugins.
- Implement a new UI for submitting plugin ratings and reviews.
- Introduce new checkbox, radio group, and divider components.
- Add support for accordion and accordion-pro components with enhanced features.
- Implement a new hook for managing accordion state and interactions.
- Add support for custom styling and theming for dynamic components.
- Introduce a new utility function for creating component results.
- Add support for new input types and validation rules.
- Implement a new hook for managing component state and value changes.
- Add support for custom event handlers and callbacks.
- Introduce a new context for sharing component configurations.
- Add support for new data types and formats.
- Implement a new method for validating component values.
- Add support for custom error messages and handling.
- Add support for new component types and features.
- Add support for new plugin types and features.
- Add support for new settings and options.
- Add support for new storage formats and locations.
- Add support for new plugin sources and repositories.
- Add support for new plugin categories and tags.
- Add support for new dependency management tools and workflows.
- Add support for new plugin documentation formats and sources.
- Add support for new rating and review systems and platforms.
- Add support for new feedback and communication channels.

</details>

Add plugin management, including a plugin market, installation, and configuration.

New Features:
- Added a plugin market to browse and install plugins.
- Implemented plugin management capabilities, allowing users to install, update, and uninstall plugins.
- Introduced plugin configuration UI based on plugin-provided configuration schema.

Tests:
- Added plugin update event listener to refresh the plugin list after installation or uninstallation.

title: chore(deps-dev): bump vite from 6.0.7 to 6.0.9

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [vite](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/tree/HEAD/packages/vite) from 6.0.7 to 6.0.9.
Release notes

Sourced from vite's releases.

v6.0.9

This version contains a breaking change due to security fixes. See https://github.com/vitejs/vite/security/advisories/GHSA-vg6x-rcgg-rjx6 for more details.

Please refer to CHANGELOG.md for details.

v6.0.8

Please refer to CHANGELOG.md for details.

Changelog

Sourced from vite's changelog.

6.0.9 (2025-01-20)

  • fix!: check host header to prevent DNS rebinding attacks and introduce server.allowedHosts (bd896fb)
  • fix!: default server.cors: false to disallow fetching from untrusted origins (b09572a)
  • fix: verify token for HMR WebSocket connection (029dcd6)

6.0.8 (2025-01-20)

  • fix: avoid SSR HMR for HTML files (#19193) (3bd55bc), closes #19193
  • fix: build time display 7m 60s (#19108) (cf0d2c8), closes #19108
  • fix: don't resolve URL starting with double slash (#19059) (35942cd), closes #19059
  • fix: ensure server.close() only called once (#19204) (db81c2d), closes #19204
  • fix: resolve.conditions in ResolvedConfig was defaultServerConditions (#19174) (ad75c56), closes #19174
  • fix: tree shake stringified JSON imports (#19189) (f2aed62), closes #19189
  • fix: use shared sigterm callback (#19203) (47039f4), closes #19203
  • fix(deps): update all non-major dependencies (#19098) (8639538), closes #19098
  • fix(optimizer): use correct default install state path for yarn PnP (#19119) (e690d8b), closes #19119
  • fix(types): improve ESBuildOptions.include / exclude type to allow readonly (string | RegExp)[] (ea53e70), closes #19146
  • chore(deps): update dependency pathe to v2 (#19139) (71506f0), closes #19139
Commits
  • a55f8ba release: v6.0.9
  • bd896fb fix!: check host header to prevent DNS rebinding attacks and introduce `serve...
  • 029dcd6 fix: verify token for HMR WebSocket connection
  • b09572a fix!: default server.cors: false to disallow fetching from untrusted origins
  • c0f72a6 release: v6.0.8
  • f2aed62 fix: tree shake stringified JSON imports (#19189)
  • db81c2d fix: ensure server.close() only called once (#19204)
  • 47039f4 fix: use shared sigterm callback (#19203)
  • 3bd55bc fix: avoid SSR HMR for HTML files (#19193)
  • e690d8b fix(optimizer): use correct default install state path for yarn PnP (#19119)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/KarinJS/Karin/network/alerts).

## Summary by Sourcery

Release version 1.0.0.

New Features:
- Add magic.
- Add QQGroup Discord.
- Merge dev branch, add TypeScript support, add npm package support, and retain compatibility with older modules.
- Add issue templates.
- Add group file and private chat file interfaces, and remove the SendMessageByResId interface.
- Add association configuration items.
- Add type declarations.

Tests:
- Fix forwarding and context.

</details>

title: build(deps): bump express from 4.19.2 to 4.20.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [express](https://github.com/expressjs/express) from 4.19.2 to 4.20.0.
Release notes

Sourced from express's releases.

4.20.0

What's Changed

Important

  • IMPORTANT: The default depth level for parsing URL-encoded data is now 32 (previously was Infinity)
  • Remove link renderization in html while using res.redirect

Other Changes

  • 4.19.2 Staging by @â€‹wesleytodd in expressjs/express#5561
  • remove duplicate location test for data uri by @â€‹wesleytodd in expressjs/express#5562
  • feat: document beta releases expectations by @â€‹marco-ippolito in expressjs/express#5565
  • Cut down on duplicated CI runs by @â€‹jonchurch in expressjs/express#5564
  • Add a Threat Model by @â€‹UlisesGascon in expressjs/express#5526
  • Assign captain of encodeurl by @â€‹blakeembrey in expressjs/express#5579
  • Nominate jonchurch as repo captain for http-errors, expressjs.com, morgan, cors, body-parser by @â€‹jonchurch in expressjs/express#5587
  • docs: update Security.md by @â€‹inigomarquinez in expressjs/express#5590
  • docs: update triage nomination policy by @â€‹UlisesGascon in expressjs/express#5600
  • Add CodeQL (SAST) by @â€‹UlisesGascon in expressjs/express#5433
  • docs: add UlisesGascon as triage initiative captain by @â€‹UlisesGascon in expressjs/express#5605
  • deps: encodeurl@~2.0.0 by @â€‹blakeembrey in expressjs/express#5569
  • skip QUERY method test by @â€‹jonchurch in expressjs/express#5628
  • ignore ETAG query test on 21 and 22, reuse skip util by @â€‹jonchurch in expressjs/express#5639
  • add support Node.js@22 in the CI by @â€‹mertcanaltin in expressjs/express#5627
  • doc: add table of contents, tc/triager lists to readme by @â€‹mertcanaltin in expressjs/express#5619
  • List and sort all projects, add captains by @â€‹blakeembrey in expressjs/express#5653
  • docs: add @â€‹UlisesGascon as captain for cookie-parser by @â€‹UlisesGascon in expressjs/express#5666
  • âœ¨ bring back query tests for node 21 by @â€‹ctcpip in expressjs/express#5690
  • [v4] Deprecate res.clearCookie accepting options.maxAge and options.expires by @â€‹jonchurch in expressjs/express#5672
  • skip QUERY tests for Node 21 only, still not supported by @â€‹jonchurch in expressjs/express#5695
  • ğŸ“ update people, add ctcpip to TC by @â€‹ctcpip in expressjs/express#5683
  • remove minor version pinning from ci by @â€‹jonchurch in expressjs/express#5722
  • Fix link variable use in attribution section of CODE OF CONDUCT by @â€‹IamLizu in expressjs/express#5762
  • Replace Appveyor windows testing with GHA by @â€‹jonchurch in expressjs/express#5599
  • Add OSSF Scorecard badge by @â€‹UlisesGascon in expressjs/express#5436
  • update scorecard link by @â€‹bjohansebas in expressjs/express#5814
  • Nominate @â€‹IamLizu to the triage team by @â€‹UlisesGascon in expressjs/express#5836
  • deps: path-to-regexp@0.1.8 by @â€‹blakeembrey in expressjs/express#5603
  • docs: specify new instructions for question and discuss by @â€‹IamLizu in expressjs/express#5835
  • 4.x: Upgrade merge-descriptors dependency by @â€‹RobinTail in expressjs/express#5781
  • path-to-regexp@0.1.10 by @â€‹blakeembrey in expressjs/express#5902

New Contributors

  • @â€‹marco-ippolito made their first contribution in expressjs/express#5565
  • @â€‹inigomarquinez made their first contribution in expressjs/express#5590
  • @â€‹mertcanaltin made their first contribution in expressjs/express#5627
  • @â€‹ctcpip made their first contribution in expressjs/express#5690
  • @â€‹bjohansebas made their first contribution in expressjs/express#5814

Full Changelog: https://github.com/expressjs/express/compare/4.19.1...4.20.0

Changelog

Sourced from express's changelog.

4.20.0 / 2024-09-10

  • deps: serve-static@0.16.0
    • Remove link renderization in html while redirecting
  • deps: send@0.19.0
    • Remove link renderization in html while redirecting
  • deps: body-parser@0.6.0
    • add depth option to customize the depth level in the parser
    • IMPORTANT: The default depth level for parsing URL-encoded data is now 32 (previously was Infinity)
  • Remove link renderization in html while using res.redirect
  • deps: path-to-regexp@0.1.10
    • Adds support for named matching groups in the routes using a regex
    • Adds backtracking protection to parameters without regexes defined
  • deps: encodeurl@~2.0.0
    • Removes encoding of \, |, and ^ to align better with URL spec
  • Deprecate passing options.maxAge and options.expires to res.clearCookie
    • Will be ignored in v5, clearCookie will set a cookie with an expires in the past to instruct clients to delete the cookie
Commits
  • 21df421 4.20.0
